1.title: The Fundamentals of Geometry
1.subtitle: Definitions, Postulates, and Common Notions
1.introduction: Book 1 lays the foundational concepts and propositions for geometry...

2.title: Geometric Algebra
2.subtitle: Operations with Segments and Areas
2.introduction: Book 2 covers basic geometric algebra like segment addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and square roots...

3.title: Circles
3.subtitle: Tangents, Chords, Angles, and Proportions
3.introduction: Book 3 develops fundamental properties of circles starting with tangents and continuing with chord properties...

4.title: Polygons Inscribed in Circles
4.subtitle: Regular Polygons and the Circle
4.introduction: Book 4 applies results from Book 3 to characterize regular polygons inscribed in circles...

5.title: Ratio and Proportion
5.subtitle: Equality of Ratios and Proportionality
5.introduction: Book 5 assembles a theory of ratio and proportion that is relied upon in subsequent books...

6.title: Similar Figures
6.subtitle: Similarity Based on Ratio and Proportion
6.introduction: Book 6 applies the theory of ratio and proportion to build up a theory of similar figures based on corresponding angles and proportional sides...

7.title: Elementary Number Theory
7.subtitle: Divisibility, Prime Numbers, and Least Common Multiples
7.introduction: Book 7 delves into number theory and covers concepts like prime numbers, gcd, and lcm that are important for later books...

8.title: Geometric Series
8.subtitle: Summation of Finite and Infinite Series
8.introduction: Book 8 applies proportions from Book 5 to sum finite and infinite geometric series...

9.title: Number Theory
9.subtitle: Properties of Numbers
9.introduction: Book 9 continues the number theory from Book 7 and establishes important properties like odd/even numbers, factorization, and perfect numbers...

10.title: Irrational Numbers
10.subtitle: Incommensurable Magnitudes
10.introduction: Book 10 classifies numbers as rational and irrational and proves properties of several irrationals important for later books...

11.title: Three-Dimensional Geometry
11.subtitle: Definitions, Axioms, and Propositions on Solid Geometry
11.introduction: Book 11 introduces the foundations of three-dimensional geometry...

12.title: Measurement of Figures
12.subtitle: Area, Volume, and Dimension Ratios
12.introduction: Book 12 develops formulas and techniques for determining areas, volumes, and dimension ratios of plane and solid figures...

13.title: The Regular Solids
13.subtitle: Construction of the Platonic Solids
13.introduction: Book 13 constructs the 5 regular or Platonic solids - tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, dodecahedron, and icosahedron...
